feat.value: ... if one urinates into a vessel with a narrow neck or jar, into any other vessel like these, without having been ordered by the elder, except for the place of those who are very ill and the elders of advanced years and these others, he is to ask the elder.

And if it is necessary for some among us to use anything of this sort, to defecate into vessels of this sort through necessity or physical incapacity or hindrance to the foot making him unable to walk, they are to ask the elder.
Apart from these, children or anyone else, if they defecate into any vessels of this sort, let them be accursed.
The one who ordains a sinful deed against his neighbour in deceitfulness is accursed. He does not know,
but because of ill-feeling he says that which is not, whether a man or woman.
He is accursed who says by way of confusion that he has seen in a dream how so-and-so and such-and-such destroy themselves with deeds of wickedness, whether man or woman.

They are all accursed who practice deceit in any assembly of the Lord, so that God is angry with a great many people and turns His face from them in anger because of the iniquities of those among us who practice wrongful deeds, covertly or overtly.
And woe to those by whom God will be distressed and from whose midst He will seek for a way to come,
like a just man, having sought for a way to abandon a people because of their wicked deeds, as the prophet says:
Who is it that will give to me in the desert a distant dwelling place?
That I may abandon this people and remain far removed from them.'
Blessed is everyone with whom God will be satisfied that He may be pleased to remain in their midst,
like a just man content with just men and pleased to remain in their midst, because He Himself the Lord is in their midst at all times because of the right and just deeds.
All those of us who see a deceitful thing in defilement or blasphemy or any other sort of sin leading to death
and do not tell me who or what those wicked deeds are,
all these curses will come down upon them from God, whether man or woman.
All the things that it is fitting to write in this letter and which we have not written, they are all written on the papers written from the beginning.
The holy words of Our Lord Jesus written in the Scriptures and in this letter, I will tell you what they are like.
They are like candles that burn in places of darkness. And they are like the light of day.
And the mindless, whose acts of stupidity abound, are like bats.
And like those who are struck down or run in to the darkness or places where bats are dug deep, namely bats, whenever they see the light of the lamps' flame and the light of day,

in the same way the mindless and excessively stupid will be struck down or into passions with their desires and the darkness of their false knowledge in the face of all the words of Our Lord, not only those from the Scriptures
or in this letter, but in the face of all the other words written in these documents from the beginning
Again, the holy words of Our Lord Jesus are like the light of lamps in the hands of wise men.
They illuminate him in places of darkness as he does his work, according as it is written:
'Your word is the lamp for my feet.'
They are like the light of day
and the one who pays attention to them will not stumble, as it written:
The one who walks in the day does not stumble.
For this reason, blessed are the children of light, that is, those who walk in the openness of submission and complete obedience and good.
Woe to the children of darkness, that is, those who walk in complete disobedience and ignorance.
They rush in and up to darkness in every iniquity, like the bats which rush in and up to a very deep place of darkness.
Why did the Lord God say through His saints:
If your enemy too is hungry, feed him and if he is thirsty, give him to drink?'
Why too did He say:
'If your brother does not listen to you, let him be a gentile and tax collector to you?'
But in saying this, do every good thing to your enemies, according to the commandment.
He wishes the good person of God to achieve goodness through the wickedness of the wicked person who is allotted to his sinning, Satan.
For, in place of the wickedness of the wicked person, the goodness of the good person removes the wickedness of the hostile person.
By repaying a bad deed with a good deed, he achieves the divine nature of God.
By repaying a good deed with a bad deed he achieves the godlessness of the godless devil.
By saying 'If your brother does not listen to you, let him be an enemy to you like one you have never seen,'
in the first place the Lord wishes us to cut him off from us,
and after rebuking him, perhaps he might repent after having been a stranger because of God, he being our brother,
and return and repent that we may forgive him up to seven times seventy times if he does not repeat the sin for we had planned to cut him off.
But if he decides not to turn from the sin for which we had planned to cut him off, we will cut him off from us and he will not return to us and we will not love him.
But let him be an enemy for us because of God, though he is our brother.
And in this way the God-loving one reveals his entire love for the Lord that he has loved Him more than his brother and more than his father and mother.

For it is a great perfection for a man to cut himself off from his brother or his son or his daughter or his father or his mother or any other person of his for the sake of God, when they sin against the One who created them, God.
It is a great strength for a man to love his enemies for the sake of God
and pray for those who pursue him that do harm to him for the sake of God
and bless those who curse him and sin against him.
This is what He meant by 'Let your brother be for you a gentile and tax collector for the sake of God
if he sins before the Lord.'
Your enemy too, who sins against you, love him and bless him for God's sake.
We too, brothers, inasmuch as we are partners with each other, we are the children of a single man, God,
and a single mother, heavenly Jerusalem, according to the Scriptures.
Our father and mother who gave birth to us and nourished us in the flesh, are they better than our true father and mother?
